New Records: Bangladesh win by 25 runs against Netherlands in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Shakib's classy half-century helps Bangladesh to 159-5
Tim Pringle loses his leg stump. It's been a horror ten balls for him against quality bowlers.
Losing seven wickets doesn't help, either.
Van Beek caught and bowled by Hossain
Edwards c Jaker Ali b Mustafizur 25 (Ned 117-6)
Great spell from Shakib. 0-29 from his four.
Bangladesh complete emphatic win over Netherlands
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh boost chances of Super 8s place with 25-run win
Netherlands left needing string of results to go their way
The Tigers are second in Group D on four points, two behind leaders South Africa. If they beat Nepal, they're through. The Dutch need to beat Sri Lanka and hope.
Post-Match Reflections: More importantly they got the job done.
We've come to expect a lot more from the Netherlands and their performance has been disappointing.
That is a welcome six for the Netherlands.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Fizz, who only concedes two off the bat in the 19th. Stick a fork in this one.
Mustafizur is going through all sorts of deliveries. More varieties than Heinz.
Aryan Dutt can hit a long ball, which he does over cow when Rishad drops short. That is a very big hit.
Others: Right, that's it for now, but there's a very big game starting in Group B shortly.
England's World Cup is on the line against Oman and we'll be live in about 15 minutes.
